adventure_overview: Gardening for fun and for food is how Lions will discover some of the wonders of natural science. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Discover where the food we eat comes from.

activities.name: Ground, Tree, Vine, Farm
activities.description: Activity that matches the food and where it comes from the ground, a tree, a vine, or a farm.

activities.name: Supermarket Fun
activities.description: Visit a supermarket and arrange a tour of each department to learn where food for that department comes from.

activities.name: Where Does That Food Come From
activities.description: Cub Scouts identify where different food comes from in this relay race.

requirements.text: Plant a small garden outside or in a container.

From Eggs to Planter
activities.description: Use recycled paper egg cartons to make a small herb garden.

activities.name: Sunflowers and Sunshine
activities.description: Decorate a small pot and plant sunflower seeds.

requirements.text: Visit with an individual who can demonstrate different ways to garden (outside, greenhouse, container, etc.) and the basic skills needed to garden.

activities.name: Lions Garden Like a Pro
activities.description: Plan to visit a nursery, garden, community garden, or botanical garden that will allow Cub Scouts to do some planting.
